snippet: Corporate buyers of art may view it as a way to project an image, and sometimes as an extension of the company’s work life.
abstract: Preoccupations column features art adviser Jean Efron discussing the artwork that organizations choose for their buildings or their grounds; observes corporate buyers of art may view it as a way to project an image, and sometimes as an extension of the company's work life.
lead_paragraph: Corporate buyers of art may view it as a way to project an image, and sometimes as an extension of the company’s work life.

headline.print_headline: Art Makes A Statement For Business, Too
headline.seo: Art as an Extension of the Corporate Image
headline.main: Art Makes a Statement for Business, Too
